oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. W. E. Clemmons to Sarah Jane Bettis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Pvt. William E. Clemmons, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, to Sarah Jane Bettis, later his wife Sarah Jane Clemmons Johnson. Clemmons was a Wilson County man. Written from a camp near Winchester, Tennessee, he says: "I wish it distinctly understood that I am no flatterer. I generally try to speak the true sentiments of my hart[sic]." This unit was shortly afterwards sent east to join Gen. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia.
